* The jointing structure comprises steps with an expansion gap between, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
* The elastic members are designed to be deformable to absorb the expansion or contraction of the bridge girders caused by temperature changes.
* The joint block is made of concrete or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete to provide high slip resistance and durability.
* The components are designed to be detachable for easy maintenance, and the expansion gap can be decentralized to prevent tire fall-in or stuck-in situations.
* The method of mounting the elastic members involves deforming them towards the bridge girder axis before fixing them on the other side to accommodate the bridge girder's expansion or contraction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat product chilling chamber. The system is designed to transport wheeled hand trucks into and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment or the recirculated treatment fluid.

* One embodiment of the invention features a wheel channel that is raised above the floor and has a cover plate that prevents showered or dripping fluid from entering the channel and contaminating the wheels. The cover plate can be hinged to facilitate cleaning of the channel.

* Another embodiment utilizes inflatable elastomer seals along the top edges of the wheel channel sidewalls to enclose around the wheel struts of the hand truck, preventing the entry of the treatment fluid into the channel.

* The enclosed floor track system segregates the hand truck wheel structure from the fluid treatment environment, allowing for the recovery and reuse of the treatment fluid without the need for decontamination.

* The track system can be inclined to drain any liquid that may enter the tracks, and the length of the support legs can be adjusted to achieve different angles of incline.

* The invention can be applied to various industries and transport vehicles beyond the meat product chilling example provided, as long as the principle of segregating the wheels from the treatment fluid is maintained.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device that prevents a work machine, such as a boom of a backhoe, from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that can be easily locked and unlocked manually.
* The engaging member is designed to slide and rotate along a slot, with a guide member that helps maintain the lock position at any rotation of the boom.
* The lock device is simple in construction, reduces the number of parts, and is easy to assemble, making it suitable for various work machines like excavators, loaders, and cranes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that can be adjusted to regulate the suction efficiency during the cleaning operation.
• The device has a suction head with a central, vacuum portion that can be readily adjusted relative to the pool bottom.
• The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the suction head and can be quickly operated by hand without tools.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without adjusting the remotely located suction source.
• The adjustment mechanisms can be provided in kit form to be interconnected with certain types of existing pool cleaning devices.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, and can be manufactured inexpensively.
• The device has outboard roller assemblies with adjustable rollers to maintain the end portions of the platform in a spaced relationship with the pool bottom.
• The device also has inboard roller assemblies with adjustable rollers to regulate the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom.
• The adjustment is achieved by vertically adjusting the axles of the inboard roller assemblies within slots in the housing walls.
• The adjustment device can be easily retrofitted to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modifications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving the wear bushing from around the interior of the well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting it onto the drill string.
* The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing due to excessive weight below the retriever.
* The retriever unit can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.
* The retriever unit can be easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage of other tools through a central passage, which can be subsequently closed by a removable plug.
• The tool features an annular dump valve that opens and closes without slamming against a seat, and a modular piston stack design that increases the power delivery of the tool.
• The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces to a stuck object without impacting the pistons against the housing.
• The tool's design allows for wireline access through the central passage before the plug is dropped, and the components are made more robust since they are not delivered in a dart.
• The tool can be used in various applications, including stimulation or fishing operations, and can transmit torque between the mandrel and the housing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. The retaining wall comprises a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort piece and a precast base piece, which are connected together at the job site without the need for temporary shoring.
• The invention is flexible in that the height or width of any of the individual components can vary over a wide range, and all of the pieces of the assembly can easily be made to custom sizes. The invention also includes various features such as drainage openings, reinforcing bars, shear keys, and the ability to incorporate vehicle impact barriers, as well as options for addressing poor soil conditions by using H-piles or a cast-in-place pile cap.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving oil or gas production in wells where flow is impeded due to high viscosity or paraffin blockage. The system is designed to focus heat on the production zone and prevent heat loss through the use of insulating components.
• The heating unit of the invention is designed to protect the electrical connections from the high pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore, which has been a common cause of failure in conventional down hole heaters. The electrical connections are encased in a cement block and steel fitting assembly to prevent fluid invasion and electrical shorts.
• The invention also includes a method for using the down hole heating system, which can be installed on a cable instead of production tubing to allow for heat treatment of the well during other maintenance activities when the pipe is pulled.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. The mechanism can effectively take the form of an external pull tool or overshot, or an internal pull tool or spear, depending on the particular service operation involved.

* The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure disposed in movable relation within it. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.

* A catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, depending on the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures, secures the tubular outer body about the inner body. A pin structure and a control spring ensure that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.

* Unlocking can be achieved simply by downward movement of the control line tool followed by subsequent upward movement, and locking can be achieved simply by downward movement of the pulling tool, followed by subsequent upward movement.

* The tool can be latched and unlatched as many times as necessary to accomplish the service operation, without the need to remove it from the well bore for resetting operations.

* The mechanism can be used for a wide variety of down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.

* The invention includes an alternative embodiment in the form of an overshot type grappling and removal mechanism, which functions in a similar manner to the first embodiment.

* Another alternative embodiment is adapted for engagement with a standard fishing neck of a down hole object, using an overshot type down hole pulling tool.

* The various embodiments of the invention provide efficient and effective means for installing and removing objects in wells, with simple and reliable locking and unlocking mechanisms.
</summary>

<summary>
• The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors, which includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The substrates are assembled together using glue and multidirectional holding means, such as dendrites, adhesion, and reinforcement means.

• The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, prevent deformation, and allow for corrective maintenance. The composed stave floor of the example embodiment did not exhibit deformation or detachment, and it was possible to provide corrective maintenance after a period of use.

• The example embodiment also provides improved composed stave floors with pre-applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the need for on-site application and providing higher hardness without changing the aesthetic appearance.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to ladder attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, prevent the ladder from defacing the work surface, and prevent the ladder from slipping or sliding. The invention aims to provide a non-slip gripping portion for a ladder that grips the work surface without damaging it.

* The ladder attachment includes an extension arm with a flange on one end and a resilient pad assembly on the other end. The flange is secured to the ladder rung using a U-bolt, and a clamp is used to attach the arm to the ladder siderail.

* The resilient pad assembly can pivot horizontally, allowing the ladder to straddle corners, both inside and outside. This feature improves the lateral stability of the ladder and increases the contact area with the work surface.

* The invention can be constructed using heavier gauge materials or with additional bolts to resist forces that may move the arms towards or away from the ladder, making it suitable for less substantial ladders like aluminum or fiberglass.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a collated fastener assembly, such as a nail strip, formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adheres to the fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin blend, that remains adhered to the fastener shank as the fastener is driven into a substrate, reducing the amount of debris generated.
• The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions. The connecting portion can be configured with a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, further reducing debris generation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle comprises a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a particular design.

• The nozzle can be connected to a sealant cartridge or injection machine, and the button allows for precise application of the sealant around rivets and screws. The button can be removed and replaced, and the nozzle can be used for both manual and automated sealant application.

• The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and has a threaded connecting section that allows it to be coupled to various sealant containers. The bell-shaped section is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts for complete sealing.

• The injection button has a central circular protrusion and radially oriented channels and orifices that allow for precise control of the sealant flow, directing it towards the chamfers of rivet heads or the walls of screw holes.

• An alternative embodiment of the injection button includes lateral grooves or openings, which prevent the plugging of screw holes during the sealing process, allowing for subsequent riveting.

• The nozzle simplifies the sealing work, reduces application time, and increases the quality of the sealant application, making the process more economical.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to position and motion sensors, particularly for use in mechanical systems with moving parts. It describes a sensor that can modulate a current across a pair of wires, reducing the number of wires required to connect the sensor to external monitoring equipment.
* The sensor includes a waveform generator that receives an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it based on an error correction signal. The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not provide information about the position of the object being sensed, reducing the energy required by the sensor.
* The error correction generator includes a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor. The comparator receives the conditioned sensing signal and determines its value, the controller provides timing signals based on this value, and the signal processor generates the error correction signal.
* The sensor also includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing output, adjusting it if it is above a preset high reference or below a preset low reference. The signal processor generates a small reference signal to eliminate drift, and a large reference signal to allow rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention discloses a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that eliminates the need for springs and provides variable valve displacement control.
* The system uses a rotating cam and a translating mechanism to generate a reciprocating linear motion, which is then converted into a variable reciprocating motion to control the valve position.
* The variable displacement is achieved by rotating a link that contains a slot, which determines the valve's up and down movement.
* The rotation of the link is controlled by an adjustable slide, which can be actuated by an electromechanical or hydraulic system.
* The variable valve control allows for efficient fuel consumption by adjusting the valve opening based on the engine's operating conditions.
* The system can be configured to control multiple valves per cylinder, further enhancing the engine's performance and efficiency.
* The invention offers a simplified and robust construction compared to the traditional cam-spring valve actuation system.
* The variable valve control and higher engine speed capability provided by the desmodromic system can lead to significant improvements in engine performance and fuel economy.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs. The light member includes a housing with a top side facing away from the aquarium and a bottom side facing the aquarium interior.
• The bottom side includes a lighting control region with multiple control channels and a neutral channel. The light member also includes one or more light-emitting modules that can be coupled to the control channels to emit different colors of light.
• The light member has switches to independently control the different control channels, allowing the user to adjust the color temperature of the light. The modules can be positioned along the lighting control region and can include different types of LEDs and optical elements.
• The light member can also include multiple lighting control regions, and the modules can be controlled remotely using a radio frequency (RF) signal. The light member can also include in-line timers to control the different control channels.
• The light member can be used not only for aquariums but also for lighting underneath cabinets or other structures. The light member can include a bracket for mounting it underneath a cabinet, and can be connected in series with other light members.
• The light member can also include an optics member, such as a lens or diffuser, that can be coupled to the bottom side of the light member to modify the light output.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures. The invention aims to provide a simple, flexible, and efficiently cooled apparatus that avoids the disadvantages of the known cast separating walls.

* The key feature of the invention is the use of separate inserts, instead of cast separating walls, to bound the cooling channels. This approach offers several advantages, such as reduced thermal stresses, simplified casting, and easier adjustability of the cooling system.

* The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be inserted through the blade root or tip. The apparatus can be a hollow casting with holders, in the form of rails, to secure the inserts.

* The inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape to provide cooling fluid deflection. They can be further secured by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, to the apparatus, particularly for high-speed rotor blades.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system for automatically or manually controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or a stepper motor that automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.

• The system allows the vehicle driver to switch between automatic and manual control of the throttle valve. When switching from automatic to manual control, the system ensures that the throttle valve is positioned to match the accelerator pedal command, preventing the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling. The system also allows for full manual control of the vehicle, unlike prior art systems that restrict the vehicle to low-speed operation.

• The control system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, where automatic control is preferred at low transmission ratios and manual control is preferred at high transmission ratios.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention describes a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter and produces little slag or clinkers. The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.
• The volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber, and the remaining gases are further combusted in a secondary combustion chamber. The design of the chambers and the introduction of swirl and secondary air allow for efficient combustion and separation of particulate matter.
• The burner can effectively burn wet wood with high moisture content, has a fast response time to changes in load, and can be used to replace oil and gas burners in various industrial applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes an evaporative refrigeration system that separates the evaporating water from the cooling air stream using a heat exchanger. This allows for sensible cooling without adding moisture to the useful air.
* The system uses return air from the enclosure as the working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than fresh air, resulting in greater cooling efficiency.
* A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air is further cooled by passing through the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, allowing for dehumidification of that portion of the air.
* The condenser of the vapor compression unit is placed in the discharge path of the wet side of the heat exchanger, reducing the energy required to operate the refrigeration unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump described in the text comprises two or more pump heads arranged in series, with each pump head containing an impeller that is driven by a drive structure. The drive structure is configured to commonly drive the impellers in the different pump heads.
* The pump heads are designed to allow fluid flow from one pump head to the next, with the fluid flow being combined into a single flow before entering the next pump head. This allows the pump to operate at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
* The pump can be mounted on various support structures, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to allow it to be used in different applications, such as pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.
* The pump heads are designed to be modular, allowing for easy repair or replacement of individual pump heads, and the inclusion of additional pump heads to increase the operating pressure of the pump.
* The drive structure passes through the fluid flow path between the pump heads, with features such as a biconical tubular connector and a bell-shaped cap to protect the drive components from corrosion and fouling.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an engine compression release brake system that uses less than all engine cylinders. This allows for a reduction in engine components, improving the overall robustness of the engine.
• The engine includes an engine housing with multiple cylinders, and an engine compression release brake is provided for a portion of the cylinders, which is less than all of the cylinders. This modular design allows customers to choose the desired braking horsepower for their specific application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox. Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are expected to withstand a variety of loads, including extreme loads from blade-off events.
• The link assembly includes a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link. The female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface, which dampens the translation.
• The gearbox assembly includes a gearbox and the link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox. The technical function of the embodiments is to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface that dampens the translation, with a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link.
• The mounting link can be utilized as a medium to long link to connect the engine to the gearbox, and it can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox. Extreme loads may break the rigid constraint of the mounting link by shearing the pin to allow a permitted range of motion.
• The female link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end, and the male link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end. The pin selectively prevents the relative translation of the female link and the male link, and it can serve as a fusible link that shears when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied.
• After an event that can cause the pin to shear, fuse, or otherwise release, the female link and the male link are allowed to translate relative to each other, generally axially. The radial interface between the female link and the male link provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation.
• The snap ring can be utilized to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link, and it can be installed after the male link is disposed within the female link to retain the male link at the end of the travel range to prevent the mounting link from separating after the pin is sheared.
• The use of the pin and the coulomb damping provided by the radial interface obviates the need for all

<summary>
* The invention relates to archery equipment, particularly apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
* The invention provides a point cap system, a balance pin, and a nock cap adaptor to address the shortcomings of the prior art and improve the performance and balance of arrows.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training. It aims to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, an inexpensive means for realistic training using an actual weapon, and a reliable, low-maintenance, reusable small arms training device.

• The simulator consists of various functional blocks, including a bolt interface, a trigger interface, an oscillator control, a 500 Hertz oscillator, a 10 Hertz oscillator, a firing counter, a firing decoder, a firing control, and a firing sensor. These components work together to simulate the sound and flash of small arms fire.

• The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of an M16 rifle, with the upper end designed for insertion into the rifle and the lower end housing the control circuitry and the plastic expendable containing the pyrotechnic charges. The expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing the cost.

• The concept behind the simulator is the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic charge by heating a bridge wire to incandescence. The burning of the charge produces combustion by-products, which, when contained in a fixed volume, create a rapid increase in pressure that ruptures the plastic sealant and vents through the exit port, simulating the sound and flash of small arms fire.

• The invention provides a cost-effective and realistic solution for small arms training, without the need for live ammunition or mechanical actuation, and with the added benefit of being reusable and low-maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of the air flow to improve the volumetric efficiency of the engine while reducing noise from the air intake.
• The device comprises a tank, a first pipe with a valve, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, which together form a resonator to absorb the intake noise.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a two-part bracket that allows simple mounting of speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure.
• The stationary bracket is attached to the mounting surface, and the adjustable bracket is attached to the product that requires directional positioning.
• The adjustable bracket is then positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole, and the two brackets are secured together using screws.
• The bracket assembly includes a pole clamp assembly that allows the stationary bracket to be easily mounted on a pole of various sizes.
• The invention allows a single person to install a heavy item by providing a simple and effective mounting system.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosure relates to a burner that can be used with a variety of modular heat-utilizing appliances, such as cookers, smokers, and pyrolyzers.
• The burner features a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, air inlets, and a constricted exhaust outlet to support efficient and clean combustion.
• The burner can be coupled to the various modular appliances through manual couplings, allowing for interchangeable use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine with a housing cooling system that aims to improve fuel economy and durability. The cooling system is designed to address the uneven heating and thermal distortion issues caused by the in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water jacket passageway.

* The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of the spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway, with the bosses skewed with respect to the centerplane of the flow. This arrangement promotes a controlled and high-velocity flow around the bosses, improving the heat transfer coefficient and preventing the accumulation of vapor bubbles.

* The staggered configuration of the spark plug bosses, along with the use of flow diverters, results in a more uniform temperature distribution across the gas-side surface of the housing wall, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and structural failure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of using control valve position as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
* The method calculates the total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet control valves as a function of control valve position and compensates for the flow change due to the closure of one of the valves during testing.
* The flow characteristics for the system with N valves and N-1 valves are determined during the turbine design process, and the difference in flow characteristics is used to adjust the flow through the remaining valves to maintain constant total flow.
* The method was tested on a simulated turbine system and was found to reduce the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% during the control valve test.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that can combine fluids from two separate sources into one mixture. The mixing valve has a valve body with a first inlet passage for receiving a first fluid, a second inlet passage for receiving a second fluid, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
* The valve body also has a valve means disposed within the body for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage. The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range, in an analog fashion, between a proportion of about 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to about 100% first fluid, 0% second fluid.
* The valve system includes a flow restricting device that can be used to reduce the flow rate of the first fluid entering the first inlet passage. This, along with the size of the bores in the valve, allows the system to maintain essentially constant fluid pressures at the first and second inlet passages.
* The maximum flow rate of fluid through either bore occurs only when the bore is axially aligned with its respective fluid communication passages. As the valve is rotated, the flow rate of fluid through the bores is diminished, further helping to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
* The valve body is preferably made of a uniform construction, such as 304 stainless steel, and includes various passages and threaded portions for connecting the valve to the fluid sources and outlet.
* The valve member includes a cylindrical portion with a bore extending perpendicular to its longitudinal axis, and a sealing sleeve that is stretched over the cylindrical portion to form a seal with the valve body bore.
* The valve member also includes a series of consecutive cylindrical spools with channels for retaining fluid seal rings, and a set screw is provided to restrain the translational motion of the valve member within the valve body.
* An adjustment handle is fitted over the end of the valve member, and a pin extends through the handle and the valve member to lock them together. Stops on the valve body limit the rotational motion of the valve member.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and then expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure, which results in further cooling of the gas.

• The compressor station for carrying out the method includes a compressor, a heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units. The compressor compresses the gas to an excess pressure substantially above the desired exit pressure, and an expanding unit, such as an expansion turbine, is used to expand the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure.

• The compression is carried out in two primary compression stages with compressors having approximately the same pressure ratio, followed by an additional compression stage with a booster compressor. This allows for the compressors in the primary compression stages to be exchanged with one another, providing flexibility in operation.

• During the warmer season, the excess pressure is used to cool the gas through expansion, while during the colder season, the compression to the nominal pressure is sufficient, and the additional compression and expansion stages are not needed. This allows for efficient operation throughout the year.

• The use of expansion turbines in the expansion stage allows for the recovery of mechanical energy, which can be used to drive the booster compressor, reducing the overall energy consumption of the compressor station.

• Compared to conventional compressor stations with separate re-cooling units, the present invention offers significant cost savings in terms of investment and operation, as well as a reduction in the risk of accidents due to the absence of flammable cooling agents.

• The invention provides a flexible and efficient solution for compressing gas in a compressor station, particularly in permanent frost areas, by utilizing the cooling effect of gas expansion to achieve the desired exit temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
• The source document discusses a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for traditional fasteners, such as screws, to secure the cooling fan to an enclosure. This system can be used in various applications, including the automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries, where forced air movement is used for temperature control.

• The cooling fan assembly includes a motor that rotates a fan blade, and the motor is coupled to a motor carrier with a plurality of mounting legs. Each mounting leg has a pair of resilient leg portions separated by a compression gap, and the panel to which the fan is mounted has recessed portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs.

• The installation process involves inserting the turned-out portions of the resilient legs into the enlarged opening regions of the panel's openings, then applying a combined compressive and rotating force to move the resilient legs into the intermediate and residual opening regions, which compress the legs and capture them within the panel.

• The spring members on the motor carrier help to urge the motor carrier away from the panel, preventing the fan assembly from becoming disengaged due to vibrations during operation. The turned-out portions of the resilient legs are designed to not extend beyond the plane of the enclosure exterior, allowing for adjacent components to be directly abutted against the exterior.

• The cooling fan mounting system described in the source document eliminates the need for traditional fasteners, reducing the cost and labor associated with installation, while also providing a secure and vibration-resistant mounting solution for the cooling fan.
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require the use of advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, which have very little inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics. This can lead to dangerously high vibration levels that compromise the functionality of instruments and electronic payloads mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM).
* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts that incorporate novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The damping mechanism is provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts, where the most active portion of the mounts will occur.
* Two embodiments of the damper design are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper. Both designs use viscoelastic damping materials to dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat, significantly increasing the damping of the suspension vibration modes of the kinematic mount.

* The proposed mounting scheme can be arranged in a variety of configurations, such as using a set of three damped versions of the mount configuration or a truss structure. The use of a single strut design for all six mount elements is a significant design simplification.
* The mounting scheme can be arranged in a center-of-gravity configuration, where the three line-of-action intersection points are selected to be in the same horizontal plane as the instrument center-of-mass. This results in a set of six nearly uncoupled suspension vibration modes, which is important for instruments with inherent dynamic disturbances.
* The damped kinematic mounts can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important, particularly for space-based applications.

* The present invention preserves the fundamental features of kinematic mounts, such as strength, stiffness, and kinematic features, while introducing a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect the instrument from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The damping performance of the proposed designs can achieve modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping, which are at least one to two orders of magnitude greater than existing designs.
* The present invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, while maintaining the desired performance characteristics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large-size oil shear type clutch unit with interleaved clutch plates and discs that can be actuated separately to minimize residual drag.
* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for retracting the plate actuating means and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
* The clutch discs are made up of removable arcuate segments, allowing for easy replacement without disassembling the entire unit.
* The clutch unit is designed to provide improved cooling, minimum disc friction, and convenient inspection and maintenance of the disc segments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes an engine with combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders. The expansion cylinders receive hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinders and also receive water that is expanded into steam by the hot exhaust gas to create further drive for a common crankshaft.
* The invention aims to maximize the thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction by using multiple stages of expansion cylinders and water injection. This allows the final exhaust temperature to be lowered to the point where a radiator can be eliminated in an associated vehicle or system.
* The invention also includes features such as catalytic materials on surfaces that will see the hot exhaust gases, water recovery and reuse, and gearing between the expansion and combustion cylinders to optimize the output.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a steel plate with a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer and a metal alloy layer, where the metal alloy layer is removed from an area at the periphery of the plate.
* The removal of the metal alloy layer prevents the introduction of the precoat elements into the molten area during welding, and the remaining intermetallic alloy layer provides corrosion protection after heat treatment.
* The welded blank made from the plates of the invention exhibits good ductility and corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
* The parts fabricated from the welded blanks can be used for safety components in automotive vehicles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention describes a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers energy from severe weather patterns. The system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites, and communicate with a microprocessor system on the mobile structure.

• The mobile structure can be a sailing or propelled vessel, barge, or any mobile buoyant energy recovery system, and it is equipped with various sensors and control circuits that communicate with the microprocessor system. The SCADA system optimizes the efficiency of the energy recovery system by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, and relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure.

• The SCADA system includes a central service facility, which can be a large vessel or a port facility, where the remote control of the mobile structure occurs. The central service facility houses the server for aggregating weather data and communicating with the mobile structure through various wireless communication systems.

• The SCADA system includes a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on client workstations at the central service facility, which allows human operators to monitor and control the mobile structure's operation, including adjusting points of sail, rudder rotation, turbine gate openness, and ballast draft.

• The SCADA system also includes a path cost algorithm that can guide the navigation of the mobile structure past weather patterns, even if the structure is not engaged in energy extraction. The algorithm takes into account various factors, such as land masses, air and water temperature, wind direction and speed, and wave data, to determine the optimal path.

• The present invention is not limited to the implementation of a specific energy recovery system, but can be applied to any mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns, such as electrical storms, windstorms, or tropical storms and hurricanes, and can be operated remotely to avoid the risks associated with human crews.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction. The invention also relates to a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage.

* The rolling body guide cage is composed of at least two flat material ring segments that are joined and welded together in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling.

* This reduces the cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques, particularly for cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.

* The flat material ring segments are put together across an engagement zone and welded along the edge regions facing each other, forming an undercut geometry that preliminarily couples the ring segments.

* The flat material ring segments can be cut as 120° segments, requiring only three weld points to join the ring element, and can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.

* The concept of the production of the rolling body guide cage from a welded ring segment is suitable for the manufacture of radial and axial bearing cages, including groove and angular ball bearings.

* The method involves composing the ring element from at least two flat material ring segments, which are then welded together, typically by laser welding, before the forming step to create the axial profiling and guide structures.
</summary>

<summary>
* The methods and systems described in the text provide a way to obtain and process information related to a customer's service location, including obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates of the location using a global positioning satellite system.
* The methods and systems also provide a way to generate driving directions for a service technician traveling from one customer service location to another using the obtained location coordinates.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a digital control unit. The control unit processes the signals from the two real sensors to generate virtual sensor signals that represent the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The control unit uses independent control loops to modify the virtual sensor signals and generate control signals for the compensation coils. If two compensation systems are used in close proximity, the control unit accounts for feedback effects between the systems by using a feedback matrix to adjust the virtual sensor signals.
* The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and can simulate the measurement of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected. The control algorithms can be linear or nonlinear, and can be adapted to different control configurations without the need for extensive recalculation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy.
• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site in the sample by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes.
• The invention allows the introduction of resonance sites that are not inherently present in the sample, enabling selective detection and imaging.
• The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures that are normally not detectable by CARS microscopy.
• Bioorthogonal reactions such as Diels-Alder reactions and Staudinger ligation are particularly advantageous for use in the method.
• The invention can be used to introduce a defined background for CARS microscopy, improving reproducibility and quantitative analysis.
• The method combines the advantages of CARS microscopy with the selectivity of bioorthogonal reactions, allowing for improved specificity and sensitivity.
• The invention can be used to tag and visualize various samples, including cells, tissues, and food products.
• The method involves a two-step process: first, the sample is equipped with a bioorthogonal functional group, and then a tagging substance with a complementary functional group is introduced.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians or autosegmentation programs. It allows for the comparison of a "gold standard" segmentation approved by a clinician against other segmentations.
• The system converts the segmentations into volume models and compares them to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements. It then outputs a measure of conformance between the segmentations based on a metric method.
• The system can display the segmentations overlaid on a cross-sectional image of the patient's anatomy, with the common, missing, and extra volume elements highlighted in different colors. This can assist in improving segmentation skills or evaluating autosegmentation programs.

• The metric method used can be customized by the user, allowing for the consideration of factors such as the distance of errors from the desired segmentation surface. This can help approximate the clinical significance of the errors.
• The system can automatically select the appropriate metric method based on the structure being segmented, and it can display a histogram showing the distribution of missing and extra volume elements by distance.
• The system can be used for training clinicians, periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines, and evaluation of autosegmentation programs against updated or new imaging technology.

• The system can receive segmentation files in the DICOM-RT standard and can align the segmentations to a common reference space. It can also display the underlying medical image used for the segmentation.
• The system provides a user interface for identifying the segmentation files to be compared, selecting the structures to be evaluated, and customizing the metric method.
• The system outputs a quantitative evaluation of the comparison, including the volumes of the segmentations, the missing and extra volumes, and the metric score. This can be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the patient's internal anatomy.
• The present invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described, and it can be modified and combined in various ways within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus and method for accelerating the execution of floating point operations, particularly the effective subtraction operation. The floating point format has the disadvantage that the execution of addition and subtraction operations is more complex and requires a greater time period than the same operation in the standard data format.

• The effective subtraction operation can be accelerated by first considering the situation where the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands is less than or equal to one, or is greater than one. When the absolute value of the difference is greater than one, the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure that a positive resultant quantity is obtained, obviating the necessity of a step for the negation of the resulting operand.

• When the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents is less than or equal to one, the alignment of the fractions can be performed without requiring a separate step, and either the normalization step or the rounding step is required, but not both. The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument, and based on this subset difference, determining a difference in the operand fractions (or fractional portion thereof) during the time that the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments is being calculated.

• The subset is chosen so that when the complete difference is determined and the current procedure determined to be the incorrect procedure, the correct resulting fraction is available. This is accomplished by providing that, when the operand fractions are shifted by an amount represented by any operand argument position not in the subset, the shifted operand fraction has a value of zero, and the non-shifted operand fraction becomes the final resulting fraction.

• The difference in the operand argument subsets can identify the only combination of operand fractions for which an operation (subtraction) must be performed. This operation requiring a calculation is initiated prior to the determination of the difference between the complete operand arguments, so that when the difference between the complete operand arguments is available, the final fraction result, if a calculation is required, will be at least in progress, thereby accelerating the computation.

• The apparatus implementing the procedures includes a 7-bit subtraction unit that calculates the difference between the 7 least significant bits of the operand exponent arguments, a detection and logic unit that receives the

<summary>
• The present invention discloses a method for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient. It involves storing unique machine-readable codes associated with the patient's identification, the order to obtain the specimen, the specimen-taker's identification, and the specimen container. The processor of the computer then stores these codes in a relational manner and generates a signal to acquire the specimen and place it in the container.
• The invention also includes a system for tracking specimens acquired from a patient, where a computer communicates with an electronic reading means to read the unique machine-readable codes and store them in a relational manner. The system ensures that the specimen is placed in the correct container and within a predetermined time, and it can also detect if the specimen container is out-of-date.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses GPS and voice recognition technology to provide the user with distance and other relevant information.
• The device can also record geographic coordinates of a golf course, including its hazards and fairway boundaries, and use this information to calculate distances and provide advice to the user.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic. This is achieved by creating customized design rules for different types of memory regions based on modifying a standard set of logic rules.
* The customized design rules are created by running a design rule check on a memory bit cell mask pattern data against a design rule command file that consists of only standard foundry logic rules, analyzing the resulting violations, and then modifying the standard logic design rules to create a set of distinct and separate design rules for each type of memory.
* The invention ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules, avoiding false errors and being more reliable and efficient than prior art techniques.
* The invention can be implemented on a conventional computer system executing software routines and programs, and can be applied to any mask pattern database, including ones having no memory blocks or multiple types of memory blocks, by identifying different types of memory regions in the layout.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention was made with government support and is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent application. The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.

• Conventional illumination systems require a substantial amount of space and can suffer from stability problems, alignment difficulties, and obstruction of other light beams. Waveguide holograms can provide improved, controlled illumination of such objects.

• Waveguide holograms are flat and can be optically contacted to the objects they illuminate, replacing the complicated systems of conventional illumination. They occupy much less space compared to conventional lens illumination systems.

• Waveguide holograms can achieve very high diffraction efficiency, approaching 99%, and the undiffracted light is trapped in the waveguide, reducing stray light.

• Alignment of the laser beam is critical with a laser-illuminated single-mode waveguide hologram, which can lead to a lack of ruggedness. Temporal coherence of the source must exceed the time delay across the hologram.

• Nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction is inevitable and must be compensated for, either a priori or a posteriori, to achieve uniform illumination.

• Waveguide holograms tend to produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side, which can be a disadvantage for illuminator holograms and must be addressed.

• Spectral dispersion can be redressed by providing an input grating or hologram diffractor with an output direction equal or opposite to the angle of the hologram output.

• Two basic architectures were used to record the waveguide hologram grating, and the quality of the reconstructed beams was analyzed from various points of view.
</summary>

<summary>
• This document describes a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, such as those used in electric motors and generators. The invention provides a non-destructive way to measure the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of a rotor to identify potential defects.

• The test apparatus includes a test head with an exciting winding that creates an alternating magnetic field to magnetize the rotor as it is rotated. Voltage and current sensing coils in the test head measure the induced voltages and currents, which are used to calculate the resistance and reactance of the rotor.

• A skew sensing coil is also included to measure the effective electrical skew of the rotor. The test data is processed by a data processor and control processor to determine the resistance, reactance, and skew, and compare them to predetermined thresholds to identify defective rotors.

• The test apparatus includes a dual-fixture design to improve efficiency, allowing an operator to set up a rotor on one fixture while the other fixture is being tested. The results of the tests are displayed, printed, and stored for statistical analysis and quality control purposes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The text describes a method for securing a computing device by granting access to managed libraries that have a valid digital certificate, while denying access to managed applications that lack the necessary permissions. This is achieved through an arbitration layer that includes a manager and a runtime host.
* The text also discusses the use of a title player, which is a native component responsible for authenticating and launching the managed application, the manager, and the runtime host. The title player can determine if a managed application is untrusted and prevent it from accessing native system resources.
* The text further describes a process for publishing video games on a mobile device, where the video game package is verified for type-safe code and signed before being distributed to the mobile device.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to an improved identification card that contains an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* Smart cards with an IC chip and antenna are well known, but they typically have a rigid core onto which the components are positioned, which can lead to damage from bending stresses.
* The present invention addresses this issue by using a core layer and bottom sheet made of a silica-filled polyolefin, with the antenna and chip sandwiched between them and encased in a flexible laminate.

* The core layer and bottom sheet are pre-shrunk to prevent shrinking during the manufacturing process. Alkyd resin spids are printed on the bottom side of the core layer, and silver-epoxy antennae are screen-printed onto the spids.
* The core layer and bottom sheet are joined using an adhesive layer, with recesses cut to accommodate the thicker IC chips. Two polymer layers, such as polyester or polycarbonate, are then attached to the core and bottom layers using adhesive.
* In one embodiment, an image-receiving layer suitable for dye diffusion thermal transfer printing is provided on the polymer layers, and a protective layer is applied over the image-receiving layers.

* In an alternate embodiment, an inkjet receiver coating is applied to the core layer, and personalized data is printed on this coating before the polymer layers are attached.
* The identification cards of the present invention provide improved durability and ease of manufacture compared to the prior art, as the electronic components are protected by the flexible laminate structure.
* The invention provides a unique structure that dissipates external forces over a broad area of compliant layers, thus protecting the delicate electronic components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue using a tree-shaped data structure in a functional memory environment. The tree structure has a balance condition where all leaf nodes are at the same level, and a fill condition where all internal nodes are full except for those on the edges.
* The invention also includes a header node with three elements: one pointing to the end of the queue, one pointing to the tree structure, and one pointing to the beginning of the queue. This allows for faster and more space-efficient updates compared to a traditional FIFO queue implementation.
* The invention also includes an inversion bit in the header node that allows the queue to be inverted in constant time and space, enabling the queue to be used as a double-ended queue (deque). The inversion bit can also be added to the individual nodes in the basic embodiment without a header node.
* The memory arrangement implementing the invention includes an actual memory, intermediate registers for the end and beginning of the queue, and control logic for maintaining the queue through additions and deletions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, such as DRAM and logic circuits. This allows for the integration of EPROM devices with other types of circuits on the same wafer, reducing manufacturing costs.
• The invention describes two methods for creating EPROM devices: one that uses DRAM storage capacitors as the coupling capacitors for the EPROM cells, and another that utilizes the changes in transistor properties caused by electrical stresses to store data, called "stress effect programmable read-only memory" (SEPROM) devices.
• SEPROM devices can be manufactured using any IC technology and are well-suited for embedded applications, as they can store large amounts of data at low cost and the stored data is not physically detectable. However, writing data to SEPROM devices may take longer than writing to floating gate EPROM devices.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a technique for determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control. The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain value, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined gain, detecting the error, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating these steps with different gain values to determine the gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value.
* For determining the proportional gain, the evaluation value is the ratio of the length of the error curve to the time axis, and the optimum gain is the one that minimizes this value. For the integral gain, the evaluation value is the integral of the error, and the optimum gain is the one that makes this value closest to zero. For the differential gain, the evaluation value is the integral of the absolute value of the error, and the optimum gain is the one that makes this value closest to zero.
* The method is applied to the running control of an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV), where the optimum gains are determined for different sections of the running course. The evaluation functions are suited for evaluating the stability, accuracy, and response of the running control, and the optimum gains can be determined quickly and accurately without using complicated analytical processes.
* The method can be implemented in two ways - by repeatedly running the AGV in each course section to determine the gains, or by continuously running the AGV along the entire course and determining the gains at the section boundaries. The initial gain values can be set differently for each course section to reduce the processing time.
</summary>

<summary>
* This invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while still permitting the physical size to be minimized.
* The zoom lens comprises five lens units, with the fourth and fifth lens units designed to correct various aberrations.
* Conditions (1)-(4) are defined to achieve good correction of aberrations, including spherical aberration, coma, and chromatic aberrations.
* Condition (5) is defined to achieve a reduction in the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation of aberrations with zooming.
* The fourth lens unit is a bi-convex lens with the rear surface of strong curvature, and the fifth lens unit has a specific lens arrangement to correct residual aberrations.
* Four numerical examples of the zoom lens are provided, with the total length ranging from 9.13 to 9.19 times the diagonal of the effective picture frame.
* The invention achieves a large relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide-angle end, with a reduced size of the entire lens system.
* The design of the fourth and fifth lens units is crucial in correcting the aberrations and achieving the desired performance.
* The invention represents a significant advancement in the development of compact, high-performance zoom lenses for photographic and video cameras.
* The zoom lens design principles and the specific numerical examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons in a detector.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal.
* The device includes a detector, a first fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second slow amplifier for integrating signals.
* The signals are tapped on the low-voltage side of the detector to improve the signal-to-noise ratio and prevent interference from leakage currents.
* The signals are separated based on their rate using capacitors, inductors, or filters to enable both individual particle detection and signal integration.
* The device can be used to detect particles in particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices like X-ray and CT scanners.
* The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material to detect uncharged particles.
* The use of a material like diamond enables fast charge transport and detection of individual particles at high rates as well as signal integration.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly used in a friction clutch. The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring that can frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.

• The driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub connected to a torque motor. The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring, reducing the frictional force on the driven disc assembly until it begins to rotate under the torque motor's predetermined torque.

• An electronic position sensor measures the distance between the rings before and after the driven disc assembly starts rotating, and the difference is compared to a standard to determine if the assembly is excessively warped.

• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement, and it generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.

• The control system includes a microprocessor that reads signals from various sensors and controls the operation of the servo motor and torque motor.

• The microprocessor follows a programmed sequence to engage the driven disc assembly, apply torque, gradually reduce the frictional force, and measure the rotation and distance difference.

• If the distance difference exceeds the standard, the microprocessor halts the process and generates a visible alert to the operator that the driven disc assembly is defective.

• The apparatus can store the measurement data for each tested assembly, enabling statistical process control.
</summary>

<summary>
* This application claims priority to a U.S. Provisional Patent Application filed on October 5, 2012.
* The subject matter of this disclosure was made with government support under Army Research Office grants.
* The present invention is directed to face age-estimation methods, systems, and software.
* Face recognition is a challenging task in computer vision due to large variations in human faces.
* Aging of human faces is a complicated process influenced by many factors such as gender, ethnicity, and environmental factors.
* The face age-estimation problem can be addressed with computer software that recognizes the ages of individuals in a given photo.
* The present disclosure uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images.
* The feature vectors are used as inputs to an age classifier and two aging functions to estimate the age of a face.
* The age classifier distinguishes between youths and adults, and the appropriate aging function is used to determine the estimated age.
* The methods and software can be implemented on a computing system that includes a processor, memory, and storage device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device that can display two merged images, where the first image has a higher definition than the second image. The device has a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, where some pixels are dedicated to displaying the first image and others are dedicated to displaying the second image.
* In one embodiment, each arrangement has four pixels, with three pixels displaying the first image and one pixel displaying the second image. In another embodiment, each arrangement has four pixels, with two pixels displaying the first image and two pixels displaying the second image.
* The pixels dedicated to the second image can be configured to display a single color different from the color of the pixels dedicated to the first image. The remaining pixels can be configured to display two colors that, when combined, restore the color of the first image.
* The controller can apply an attenuation function to the pixels of the first image that overlap with the second image, to ensure the first image remains clearly visible. The controller can also apply a combination of the first image signals to the remaining pixels when the second image is not visible or barely visible.
* The matrix display device can include two separate controllers, one for the pixels dedicated to the first image and one for the pixels dedicated to the second image, allowing for different resolutions and refresh rates for the two images, reducing overall power consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which has a removable payment element that can be used for cashless payments.
* The identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and a secure state, where in the secure state the payment element is removed, and a closure protects and seals the receptacle for the payment element.
* The closure can be movably mounted on the housing and can move between an active position, where it seals the receptacle, and a passive position, where the payment element can be inserted.
* The communication means of the identification transmitter can be used for both communication with the security system of the motor vehicle and communication with the payment system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The source document describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use. When the device is inactive for a long period, the toner used in the device may lose its tribo charge, leading to inconsistent and darker image quality when the device is used again.
* The document presents two methods to address this issue. The first method involves determining the period of inactivity, predicting the next user usage, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the calculated decay of the tribo charge. The second method involves measuring the toner charge level before and after the inactivity period, and then charging the toner based on the difference in the charge levels.
* The document also discusses the implementation of the disclosed methods, which can be readily implemented in software or hardware using known systems and structures. The methods are designed to overcome or reduce the problems encountered in the related art developer, ensuring consistent image quality during normal operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can independently and precisely regulate bias currents supplied to multiple magneto resistive (MR) heads mounted on a rotary drum. It achieves this by transmitting control signals from the stationary side to the rotary side through a single channel of a rotary transformer.
• The invention also provides a recording/reproducing apparatus that can switch over among multiple heads with high precision, particularly a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over multiple MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed. This is achieved by transmitting data for controlling the switching over among the heads with priority over other control data.
• The invention can be applied not only to rotary magnetic head type apparatuses but also to disk apparatuses. It can also be used for the transmission of frequency-modulated analog signals, not just digital signals. The invention is particularly useful for apparatuses with MR heads, as well as for those with integrated circuits, where the increased number of functions and integrated circuits result in a substantial increase in the quantity of necessary data.
• The rotary magnetic head type apparatus of the invention has a control signal generator on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit on the rotary drum side. The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer and set the operating currents of the MR heads.
• In another embodiment, the apparatus has a regenerative integrated circuit comprising a current supply circuit and a regenerative amplifier, mounted on the rotary drum to switch over among the multiple MR heads for operation in turn. The three-line signals for controlling the regenerative integrated circuit are supplied from the decoder circuit, requiring only one control line for transmission from the stationary side to the rotary side.
• To prevent loss or wrong setting of data at the time of head switching, the invention gives top priority in the transmission of digital data to head switching signal data and MR current control signal data. This ensures stable data reproduction by finalizing the head switching operation and the setting of the MR head operating current early.
• The invention can also be applied to control the switching over among multiple recording heads. By transmitting the data for controlling the switching over among the recording heads with priority, erroneous recording of signals can be prevented.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, particularly when a second object is adjacent to the first.
• The prior art techniques of passive magnetic locating and active current induction can become distorted when there are interfering objects close to the cable being traced.
• The present invention provides a system and method that improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the adjacent objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields associated with these currents.
• The transmitter can be positioned optimally relative to the cables to enhance the performance of the system.
• The invention can produce distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables, making it easier to locate and trace them.
• The currents in the cables can be distinguished by using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different rates.
• The receiver processes the signals from the two cables to produce a pulsating output signal that is dependent on the presence of both currents.
• The invention is particularly useful when the horizontal separation between the cables is less than one and a half times the depth of the cable to be located and traced.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The apparatus includes a selector switch to connect the telephone network to the speaker phone in an automatic answering mode, a timer to limit the duration of the call, and a bypass switch to extend the call.
